detaileddescription.para: Order to which guiding center transformation is done in momentum space.

briefdescription.para: Set the order of the transformation.

parameterdescription.para: order which is either zero or one

memberdef.argsstring: (real mass, real charge, real *B_dB, real r, real phi, real z, real pr, real pphi, real pz, real *R, real *Phi, real *Z, real *ppar, real *mu, real *zeta)
memberdef.name: gctransform_particle2guidingcenter

briefdescription.para: Transform particle to guiding center phase space.

detaileddescription.para: The transformation is done from coordinates [r, phi, z, pr, pphi, pz] to [R, Phi, Z, ppar, mu, zeta]. If particle is neutral, the transformation will be in zeroth order both in real and momentum space as that transformation is valid when q = 0.

parameterdescription.para: gradient of magnetic field vector at particle position
pointer to guiding center R coordinate [m]
pointer to guiding center phi coordinate [rad]
pointer to guiding center z coordinate [m]
pointer to guiding center parallel momentum [kg m/s]
pointer to guiding center magnetic moment [J/T]

memberdef.argsstring: (real mass, real charge, real *B_dB, real R, real Phi, real Z, real ppar, real mu, real zeta, real *r, real *phi, real *z, real *pparprt, real *muprt, real *zetaprt)
memberdef.name: gctransform_guidingcenter2particle

briefdescription.para: Transform guiding center to particle phase space.

detaileddescription.para: The transformation is done from coordinates [R, Phi, Z, ppar, mu] to [r, phi, z, ppar_prt, mu_prt, zeta_prt]. If particle is neutral, the transformation will be in zeroth order both in real and momentum space as that transformation is valid when q = 0.

parameterdescription.para: gradient of magnetic field vector at guiding center position
pointer to particle parallel momentum [kg m/s]

memberdef.argsstring: (real mass, real charge, real *B_dB, real phi, real ppar, real mu, real zeta, real *pr, real *pphi, real *pz)
memberdef.name: gctransform_pparmuzeta2prpphipz

briefdescription.para: Transform particle ppar, mu, and zeta to momentum vector.

detaileddescription.para: The transformation is done from coordinates [R, Phi, Z, ppar, mu] to [r, phi, z, pr, pphi, pz]. The transformation is done to first order.

parameterdescription.para: gradient of magnetic field vector at particle position
pointer to particle momentum R-component [kg m/s]
pointer to particle momentum phi-component [kg m/s]
pointer to particle momentum z-component [kg m/s]

briefdescription.para: Module for performing guiding center transformations.

detaileddescription.para: The guiding center transformation is done both ways between particle phase-space [r, phi, z, pr, pphi, pz] and guiding center phase-space [R, Phi, Z, ppar, mu, zeta] to first order (both in spatial and momentum space coordinates).

The guiding genter motion is defined from a basis {bhat, e1, e2}, where bhat is magnetic field unit vector. e1 and e2 are chosen so that e1 = (bhat x z) / |bhat x z| and bhat x e1 = e2. Thus we are assuming that magnetic field is never parallel to z axis.

listitem.para: particle to guiding center transformation is accomplished by calling gctransform_particle2guidingcenter()

guiding center to particle transformation is accomplished by calling gctransform_guidingcenter2particle() which gives [r, phi, z, ppar, mu, zeta] in particle coordinates. To obtain [r, phi, z, pr, pphi, pz], first evaluate magnetic field at particle position and then call gctransform_pparmuzeta2pRpphipz().

detaileddescription.para: Reference: "Guiding-center transformation of the radiation-reaction force in a nonuniform magnetic field", E. Hirvijoki et. al. https://arxiv.org/pdf/1412.1966.pdf
